messages.content: Thanks for sharing your Prolific ID. How can I assist you today?
I have feelings of Anxiety that I don't understand I do most of the time when I'm in public
I see, feeling anxious in public can be really challenging. Can you describe what triggers those feelings for you?
It affects me because I will never have confidence about that
That makes sense; lack of confidence can amplify anxiety. Have you considered small steps to gradually build your confidence in public settings?
No
That's okay! A good start might be practicing in less crowded places first. Would you be open to trying that?
I will definitely try that
Great! Taking small steps can really help. How do you feel about setting a specific time to practice?
I  feel great and I'm willing have a practice
That's wonderful to hear! What kind of setting do you think would be best for your first practice?
I don't have any idea can you help for that
Sure! Consider starting at a quiet café or a park. Those places often feel less overwhelming. How does that sound?
It sound great I will start  there
I'm glad to hear that! Just remember to take your time and breathe. How do you plan to feel afterward?
Yes I will breathe in and out so that it can boost my confidence
That’s a solid strategy! Focusing on your breath can really help calm those nerves. How about setting a small goal for your visit?
Yes
Awesome! Maybe aim to stay for a short time and observe your surroundings? That could be a good start.
Ok thank you so much
You're very welcome! I'm here to support you. Feel free to share your progress anytime!
Definitely I will do that
I'm looking forward to hearing about it! Remember, take it one step at a time.
67ea58ce873bd65dcf36c8be
Thanks for sharing your Prolific ID! How can I assist you today?
HI, I HAVE STRESS ABOUT MY RELATIONSHIP RIGHT NOW
I see, relationship stress can be really challenging. What specific issues are you facing?
I AM NOT MARRIED BUT I LOVE MY GIRLFRIENT BUT I HAVE MADE A HUGE MISTAKE
That sounds tough. It's normal to feel overwhelmed after making a mistake. Can you share what happened?
I CHEATED ON HER
I understand that must feel heavy. It’s important to reflect on what led to that choice. How do you feel about it now?
I REGRET IT
Regret can be painful but acknowledges your feelings. What steps are you considering to address this?
I TRIED TO APOPLOGISE BUT SEEMS LIKE IT IS TOO LATE AND I DO NOT WANT TO LOOSE HER
It’s understandable to fear losing her. Have you thought about how to show her you’re genuinely sorry?
SHE DOES NOT GIVE ME CHANCE TO SHOW HER
That must be really difficult. Sometimes, giving her space can help. How do you feel about that approach?
I FEELLIKE I WILL LOOSE HER FOREVER
It’s natural to feel that way. Have you considered writing her a heartfelt letter to express your feelings?
NO BUT I CAN TRY THAT
That could be a meaningful way to communicate. Focus on your feelings and remorse. How do you think she might respond?
I DO NOT KNOW
That uncertainty can be tough to sit with. Regardless of her response, what’s important is your honesty. How do you feel about being vulnerable with her?
I WILL TRY THAT ALSO
That sounds like a great step. Being open can foster understanding. Remember to be patient with her feelings too.
I WILL AND I KNOW WHAT I DID TO HER. IT IS PAINFUL
It’s good that you recognize the pain caused. Acknowledging it is the first step to healing for both of you. How are you coping with your own feelings during this time?
Thanks for sharing your Prolific ID. How can I support you today?
I am the only among my friends who is not engaged
I see how that might feel isolating. How does that impact your feelings about your friendships?
I feel like he does not love me thats why he is not popping the question
That makes sense; those feelings can be really tough. Have you talked to him about your concerns?
No ,  I do not want him to think Im too needy
I understand that worry. It's important to express your feelings while also being open. What if you approached it casually?
I tried but he told me if I wan to marry myself I should go ahead
That sounds really hurtful. It’s natural to feel upset. How do you want to respond to that?
I just dropped it and dont want to talk to him about it again
I can see why you'd want to step back. How are you feeling about your relationship overall right now?
I love him but im now thinking maybe he doesnt feel the same way
That’s a tough realization. Love can be complicated. Have you considered what you truly want from this relationship?
Yes I want to get married and have children with him
That’s a meaningful goal. It's important to align your values and desires. Do you think he shares that vision?
Yes he does but he is not ready now and I am ready
I see the conflict there. It’s tough when timing doesn’t align. How do you feel about waiting for him?
I dont mind but im tired of being the bridemaid not the bride
That’s completely understandable. Feeling stuck can be draining. What would help you manage those feelings while you wait?
I think I should stop comparing myself to my friends
That’s a great insight. Focusing on your own journey can be freeing. What steps can you take to shift that focus?
I really do not know , it's easier said than done
I get that; it can be challenging. Maybe start by practicing self-compassion. What do you enjoy about yourself?
Thanks for sharing your Prolific ID. What’s been on your mind lately?
I'm stressed
I see, stress can feel overwhelming. What do you think is causing it for you right now?
I got a job far from home
That makes sense; a long commute can add stress. Have you thought about ways to manage that commute?
No. I'm thinking of relocating
Relocating could definitely ease the stress. What’s holding you back from making that move?
I have a small baby at home
I understand, balancing a move with a baby can be tough. How are you feeling about managing both?
I'm really stressed
That’s completely understandable. Have you considered any strategies to help reduce your stress?
Working close to my family is the best
That sounds like a solid plan. How do you think that support would help you feel less stressed?
I'm thinking of moving with them
Living with family can offer great support. What do you feel are the pros and cons of that decision?
The pros are that they will be living with me. Cons are that we will be moving with them to a different environment, which is not easy in terms of adjusting.
I see, adjusting to a new environment can be challenging. What strategies can you think of to ease that transition?
We will get used
That's a positive outlook! Gradual adjustments can really help. What kind of support do you think you'll need during this change?
Emotional support
Emotional support is vital during transitions. Have you talked with your family about how they can best support you?
Thanks for sharing your Prolific ID. What’s been on your mind lately?
There's too much in my mind.  I'm stressed about financially
I see, financial stress can be overwhelming. What specific aspects are causing you the most worry?
I'm bread winner in my family so every one was looking to me in school fees and food
That makes sense; that’s a heavy responsibility. How do you usually cope with this pressure?
That's my stress where is come from because  of heavy responsibility
It’s understandable to feel stressed with such weight on your shoulders. Have you considered breaking down your responsibilities into smaller, manageable tasks?
I can't manage it because of money
I hear you; financial limitations can feel very constraining. Have you thought about creating a budget or seeking assistance programs?
664b85e7ff6eae55f19c060d
Thanks for sharing your Prolific ID. What's on your mind today?
i want us to talk about stress
I see, stress can be overwhelming at times. What specifically about stress is bothering you?
how to cope
Coping can be challenging. Have you identified any stress triggers in your life?
yes, some
That makes sense. What are some of those triggers you’ve noticed?
unfinished tasks that are due for submissions and financial crisis
Those are significant stressors. Have you tried breaking tasks into smaller parts or seeking support for financial issues?
yes but sometimes its hard
I understand, it can feel heavy. What part of managing those tasks feels hardest for you?
coping up with the changes
Change can be really tough. What specific changes are you finding most challenging right now?
changing from working on the major task at once to breaking it into smaller ones
That shift can be tricky. How about starting with just one small task each day?
maybe i will try that, i hope it will help
That sounds like a good plan. Remember, it's all about progress, not perfection. How do you feel about giving it a go?
i feel energized and ready
That's great to hear! Harness that energy and take it one step at a time. What small task will you tackle first?
designing my daily plan
Creating a daily plan is a fantastic start! What key tasks do you want to include in it?
assembling my work catalog
Assembling your work catalog sounds productive. How will you break that down into manageable steps?
Thanks for sharing your Prolific ID. How can I assist you today?
TODAY AM STRESS
I see that you're feeling stressed. Can you share what's causing it?
the was a strike where a stay today
That sounds frustrating. Strikes can disrupt plans. How did it affect your day?
its affect my day because i did not go to work
Missing work can be stressful. How do you feel about not being able to go in today?
is stressing because a have alot to do at work
I understand. Having a lot to catch up on can be overwhelming. Have you thought about breaking it down into smaller tasks?
no
That’s okay! Start by listing a few tasks to tackle first. Would that feel manageable?
yes i will be manageable
Great! Break it into small steps, and take one at a time. How does that sound?
is sound good
I’m glad to hear that! What’s the first task you’d like to focus on?
am helping people that my task everyday
That's wonderful! Helping others can be rewarding. How do you usually feel after assisting them?
i feel very happy because helping people is my calling
That's truly inspiring! It sounds like you find purpose in your work. How can you carry that positivity into your day today?
everyday when a wakeup wakeup with a smile knowing am going to help people
That’s a beautiful mindset! Starting each day with positivity can really set the tone. How do you maintain that motivation?
Thanks for sharing your Prolific ID. How are you feeling today?
Better than usual how are you
I’m glad to hear you're feeling better! What do you think is contributing to that?
all the issues i have to face every day
I see, facing daily challenges can be tough. What specific issues are on your mind right now?
main one is me working like a dog every day and i cant even spoil myself because i am the bread winner at home
That makes sense; it sounds exhausting to carry that responsibility. Have you thought about small ways to treat yourself?
everyone just wants wants wants needs wants it drives me insane
I can understand how overwhelming that can feel. It’s important to set boundaries. Have you had a chance to express your feelings to them?
i get told i must not be selfish
That’s a tough position to be in. Remember, taking care of yourself isn’t selfish; it’s essential. What would a healthy boundary look like for you?
define what you mean by that
Healthy boundaries mean knowing your limits and communicating them clearly. For example, it could mean setting aside time just for yourself each week. What do you think?
how do i give limits when everything they ask for are essential needs and when i take care of that i am left with nothing
It’s challenging when needs feel urgent. Perhaps you could allocate a specific time for your own needs, even if it's small. Could that work for you?
i cant even buy myself new clothes. what must i do, buy myself a ice cream and say i am spoiling myself? WOW
It sounds frustrating, and I get that it feels minimal. Even small treats can help recharge you. Have you considered budgeting a tiny amount for little rewards each month?
As i said i am literally left with nothing by the time i am done taking care o everyone but myself. do you think that is fair?
It doesn’t seem fair at all. Your needs are just as important. How about exploring ways to balance your responsibilities while still carving out a bit for yourself?
who do i say i am not going to help to help myself?
It’s tough to have that conversation. You might start by expressing your feelings honestly and explaining that you need time for yourself to be more supportive. How does that sound?
so i can get told im a selfish person and inconciderate
That’s a valid concern. It might help to frame your needs as a way to be more present for them. How do you think they might react if you approached it that way?
everyone would be jumping down my throat thats why i rather say nothing
I understand that feels safer, but that can lead to resentment. Would it help to practice what you’d say in a calm moment? It might make it easier when you’re ready.
i would say guys i really work hard can we please buy less meat this month. i am not saying lets not buy ijust saying lets buy less. i have stuff i need to do. how does that sound?
That sounds like a thoughtful approach! You're asking for a compromise while expressing your needs. How do you feel about bringing that up?
so much better
I’m glad to hear that! It sounds like a constructive way to start the conversation. Do you feel ready to discuss it with them?
can i give it a little time?
Absolutely, take your time. It’s important to feel comfortable before discussing it. What else can we explore in the meantime?
67cc3f4c640c0ff4df30a225
Thanks for sharing your Prolific ID! What’s been on your mind lately?
i have been feeling stressed lately
I see, stress can be overwhelming. What do you think is causing it for you?
both my grand mothers have dementia and the conditions are bad
That sounds really tough. Caring for loved ones with dementia can be emotionally draining. How are you coping with it?
very stressful and when i see them i wonder if these are their last days
It's completely natural to feel that way. Facing loss can be really heavy. Have you found any ways to manage those feelings?
i have managed to get emotional support from friends
That’s great to hear! Support from friends can really help. How do you feel when you talk to them about it?
it lightens the burden it helps to be able to offload
I’m glad that helps! Sharing can really ease the weight of stress. Do you find yourself connecting with them often?
yes but i am thinking of seeing a therapist do you think i should do that
Absolutely, seeing a therapist can provide valuable support. It might help you explore your feelings more deeply. What are you hoping to gain from therapy?
i am more worried about myself in the event that i lose my grand mothers i want to be able to accept the situation and be able to move on
That makes sense. Preparing emotionally can be really helpful. A therapist can guide you through acceptance and coping strategies. What do you think would help you most in that process?
i hope to get inner peace to heal my mind as well
Seeking inner peace is a wonderful goal. Therapy can definitely help you find tools for healing. Have you thought about what steps you might take to start this journey?
yes i am looking for good therapists
That's a positive step! Finding the right therapist is important. What qualities are you looking for in a therapist?
a very understanding one
That’s a great quality to seek. An understanding therapist can really help you feel safe. Have you considered how you'll approach the search?
today am stress because of strike
I see that strikes can create a lot of uncertainty and stress. What specific thoughts or feelings are coming up for you about it?
Am sharing you my thought because os stike
I appreciate you sharing your thoughts. What concerns you most about the strike?
because i did go to work and i have a worklord
That makes sense; working with a workload can be really overwhelming. How do you usually manage stress when it gets tough?
i keep calm and release taking my phone go to ticktok
It sounds like TikTok helps you unwind. Do you find it effective, or do you feel it adds to your stress sometimes?
yes theres a jokes on ticktok so its help alot
I'm glad to hear that! Laughter can be a great stress reliever. Are there other activities you enjoy that help you relax?
yes going to the jim execise help
That's great! Exercise can really boost your mood. How often do you get to the gym?
twice a week i go to gym
That's a solid routine! Adding a few more sessions might help reduce stress even more. How does exercising make you feel?
on exercising a gain alot of energy
That's wonderful! Gaining energy from exercise can really improve your overall well-being. Do you have any specific goals you're working toward at the gym?
no i dont have
That's perfectly fine! Sometimes just enjoying the activity is enough. What do you enjoy most about your gym sessions?
